body:
I think it's likely to be a Registry related issue, which Registry did you use when experiencing this problem?

It seems to be the issue that the Registry can not detect the removed pod and delete the item from its storage.
no,I will append in #5959 after check.

I have an idea. 
This above problem occurs under 2 conditions:
1. Wrong order of notify operation of main loop and retry task. And this problem only occurs when retry task after main loop 
2. There are two versions of data: main loop(new), retry task(old)

I is hard to break the first condition without lock. However, it is easy to break the second condition when the first condition occurs:
1. We only hold the newest notification data for various category, which are used by main loop and retry task
2. We update data before notify operation(now every implement of NotifyListener.notify are synchronized, notify operation can be considered as atomic operation) in  main loop. Then when the first condition occurs, data is the newest both in main loop and retry task. Wrong order will not lead to overwrite problem.

This solution will be easy to implement and efficient. @chickenlj

我们也做了类似的功能未开源而已，我们提供了 外放和转接（适配）功能，外放转接就是dubbo外放成http，http外放成http，http外放成dubbo服务。 转接（适配）：就是dubbo到dubbo转接，http到dubbo，http到转接功能。就是不过我们是提供几种机制：http转接到dubbo上，第三方http外放成dubbo，http转接到http的功能，并提供熔断，降级，调用权限，认证，字段权限，编排能力等指令能力。核心做法都是一样的，只是定位不一样罢了。

@SPI(FailoverCluster.NAME)

public interface Cluster {



    /**

     * Merge the directory invokers to a virtual invoker.

     *

     * @param <T>

     * @param directory

     * @return cluster invoker

     * @throws RpcException

     */

    @Adaptive

    <T> Invoker<T> join(Directory<T> directory) throws RpcException;

}



这里的 Adaptive 注解没带 value 是默认直接读 refer 的

Albumen Kevin <notifications@github.com> 于2020年4月4日周六 上午1:29写道：

> 根据源码下 dubbo-demo/dubbo-demo-annotation 工程可以复现你说的问题，结果代码跟踪后发现
> RegistryDirectory 在最新的 master 分支上的获取 URL 的逻辑已被修改，根据 Git 日志发现这部分逻辑在 c29bb65
> <https://github.com/apache/dubbo/commit/c29bb653e011e38c775bffeaae6cf525b067f274>
> 版本被修改，关联PR #5856 <https://github.com/apache/dubbo/pull/5856>
>
> [image: image]
> <https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9292748/78385760-f6c5cf80-760e-11ea-91d2-cc9789f39971.png>
>
> 修改后的 getUrl 不再被重写，导致 cluster 获取拓展实现的时候获取到的 url 的参数并没有从 refer
> 字段中解析出来，解析代码在 RegistryDirectory 构造方法中
>
>         this.queryMap = StringUtils.parseQueryString(url.getParameterAndDecoded(REFER_KEY));
>
>         this.overrideDirectoryUrl = this.directoryUrl = turnRegistryUrlToConsumerUrl(url);
>
>
> c29bb65
> <https://github.com/apache/dubbo/commit/c29bb653e011e38c775bffeaae6cf525b067f274>
> 版本之前的 getUrl 被覆写为获取 this.overrideDirectoryUrl 就可以正常获取到 refer 字段解析后的 URL，但
> c29bb65
> <https://github.com/apache/dubbo/commit/c29bb653e011e38c775bffeaae6cf525b067f274>
> 版本更改之后只能从 getConsumerUrl 中获取到，而 cluster 的自适应拓展仍使用 getUrl 读取拓展名，导致自定义
> cluster 失效。
>
> @chickenlj <https://github.com/chickenlj> 请问在 #5856
> <https://github.com/apache/dubbo/pull/5856> 中是因为什么才将 getUrl 的重写改为
> getConsumerUrl ，是有什么特殊用意吗
>

I have fixed the order problem of NotifyListener.notify yet. I have found a bug with FailedNotifiedTask.doRetry. I will fix it in this PR. 
The order problem of saveProperties(save urls to cache) also exists. I will create new issue and PR, since this PR is already so complicated.

Yes, you are right. The best way is to tag version when data are produced in provider side(or dubbo admin which will produce config info). However, it is difficult to to implement:
1.	Since providers and dubbo admin may have many instances, we need import a distributed id generator (such as leaf https://tech.meituan.com/2017/04/21/mt-leaf.html) to generate version id. 
2.	Dubbo version compatibility is also very difficult. Application with lower dubbo version will not produce data with version id. And it is almost impossible to update all applications in company.
3.	Codes with data production distribution in various projects. And it is also difficult to modify these codes to tag data version.

Notification data change no often. And it occurs rarer in a very short time which may lead disorder problem by network latency. So the problem you mentioned above occur rarely.

In my opinion, it is not worth to tag version in provider side. I produce tag in consumer side now.

I guess there is no update for this problem. @tandanzZ @ettingshausen 

## problem

The problem arises from that 

- consul registry only allows [512 bytes meta value length](https://github.com/hashicorp/consul/blob/aae14b39514d7d4e0537d35308d6959f35bfbc48/agent/structs/structs.go#L97)
- consul registry in dubbo registers a too long url in meta which exceeds 512 bytes

## url in meta

The url in meta is produced by the following code: 

https://github.com/apache/dubbo/blob/317e62f73fd0a9bac4b34eb8b2c31bbae591ef91/dubbo-registry/dubbo-registry-consul/src/main/java/org/apache/dubbo/registry/consul/ConsulRegistry.java#L278

And `url.toFullString` will add the whole params to the final string:

https://github.com/apache/dubbo/blob/317e62f73fd0a9bac4b34eb8b2c31bbae591ef91/dubbo-common/src/main/java/org/apache/dubbo/common/URL.java#L1295

https://github.com/apache/dubbo/blob/317e62f73fd0a9bac4b34eb8b2c31bbae591ef91/dubbo-common/src/main/java/org/apache/dubbo/common/URL.java#L1338

So if you use too many parameters, you will reproduce the problem.

## solution (maybe)

Becasuse dubbo uses `UrlUtils.isMatch` to check whether consumerUrl equals to the providerUrl:

https://github.com/apache/dubbo/blob/317e62f73fd0a9bac4b34eb8b2c31bbae591ef91/dubbo-common/src/main/java/org/apache/dubbo/common/utils/UrlUtils.java#L393-L422 

and this function only use `Interface`, `CATEGORY_KEY`, `ENABLED_KEY`, `GROUP_KEY`, `VERSION_KEY`, `CLASSIFIER_KEY` in url to compare.

So consul registery in dubbo can only register these five elements in registry instead of using `url.toFullString` to register the whole url in meta.

If this problem is not solved, consul as a registration center is not practical.

dubbo:

Sorry, I made a mistake

the real reason may be :
  
`org.apache.dubbo.registry.nacos.NacosRegistry#org.apache.dubbo.registry.nacos.NacosRegistry#execute `
[execute(namingService -> namingService.registerInstance(serviceName, instance));](https://github.com/apache/dubbo/blob/317e62f73fd0a9bac4b34eb8b2c31bbae591ef91/dubbo-registry/dubbo-registry-nacos/src/main/java/org/apache/dubbo/registry/nacos/NacosRegistry.java#L152)

the lambda expression will call `com/alibaba/nacos/client/naming/NacosNamingService#registerInstance(String serviceName, Instance instance)`
```
  public void registerInstance(String serviceName, Instance instance) throws NacosException {
        this.registerInstance(serviceName, "DEFAULT_GROUP", instance);
    }

```

so no matter what `dubbo,registry.group` is , it will registry to group `DEFAULT_GROUP`

@tandanzZ @ettingshausen In version 2.7.x, dubbo introduces the `metadata center` and `config center` which aim to release the pressure of the registry center. So I think this can help us to solve the problem.

## how to solve the problem

- Firstly, we can set `simplified` to `true` in [dubbo registry attributes](http://dubbo.apache.org/en-us/docs/user/references/xml/dubbo-registry.html) to make consul store a shorter url in meta. 

    - xml configuration like this
       ```xml
       <dubbo:registry address="consul://127.0.0.1:8500" simplified="true" />
       ```

    - api configuration like this 
       ```java
       RegistryConfig registryConfig = new RegistryConfig();
       registryConfig.setAddress("consul://127.0.0.1:8500");
       registryConfig.setSimplified(true);
       ```

- Secondly, we can use the `metadata center` and `config center` to store the information of the parameters in url. This is an optional way, and we can skip this step.

## reference

- [Dubbo2.7 三大新特性详解](https://www.cnkirito.moe/dubbo27-features/)
- [一文聊透 Dubbo 元数据中心](https://www.cnkirito.moe/dubbo-metadata/)

A new algorithms "[Consistent Hashing with Bounded Loads](https://cn.bing.com/academic/profile?id=444fbd87cfcfb664f18caac119986420&encoded=0&v=paper_preview&mkt=zh-cn#)"introduced by Vahab Mirrokni (work at Google Research) in 2018 can resolve this problem.

Brief introduction quoted from  a blog which use this new algorithm and works well (https://medium.com/vimeo-engineering-blog/improving-load-balancing-with-a-new-consistent-hashing-algorithm-9f1bd75709ed):

Here is a simplified sketch of the algorithm. Some details are left out, and if you intend to implement it yourself, you should definitely go to the original paper for information.
First, define a balancing factor, c, which is greater than 1. c controls how much imbalance is allowed between the servers. For example, if c = 1.25, no server should get more than 125% of the average load. In the limit as c increases to ∞, the algorithm becomes equivalent to plain consistent hashing, without balancing; as c decreases to near 1 it becomes more like a least-connection policy and the hash becomes less important. In my experience, values between 1.25 and 2 are good for practical use.
When a request arrives, compute the average load (the number of outstanding requests, m, including the one that just arrived, divided by the number of available servers, n). Multiply the average load by c to get a “target load”, t. In the original paper, capacities are assigned to servers so that each server gets a capacity of either ⌊t⌋ or ⌈t⌉, and the total capacity is ⌈cm⌉. Therefore the maximum capacity of a server is ⌈cm/n⌉, which is greater than c times the average load by less than 1 request. To support giving servers different “weights”, as HAProxy does, the algorithm has to change slightly, but the spirit is the same — no server can exceed its fair share of the load by more than 1 request.
To dispatch a request, compute its hash and the nearest server, as usual. If that server is below its capacity, then assign the request to that server. Otherwise, go to the next server in the hash ring and check its capacity, continuing until you find a server that has capacity remaining. There has to be one, since the highest capacity is above the average load, and it’s impossible for every server’s load to be above average. This guarantees some nice things:
No server is allowed to get overloaded by more than a factor of c plus 1 request.
The distribution of requests is the same as consistent hashing as long as servers aren’t overloaded.
If a server is overloaded, the list of fallback servers chosen will be the same for the same request hash — i.e. the same server will consistently be the “second choice” for a popular piece of content. This is good for caching.
If a server is overloaded, the list of fallback servers will usually be different for different request hashes — i.e. the overloaded server’s spillover load will be distributed among the available servers, instead of all landing on a single server. This depends on each server being assigned multiple points in the consistent hash ring.
